item.title: MongoDB for Data-Intensive Applications
item.description: MongoDB is scalable and schema-less NoSQL key-value storage, which makes it handy for applications to use as a persistent layer. The two features in this post views and change streams from MongoDB can turn your application into a full-fetched back-end engine for data-intensive applications. Change Streams Since MongoDB 3.6 you can use change streams to create event-driven applications for data processing. Whenever an update occurs in a specific collection, MongoDB triggers a change event with the modified data.
